required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effects of Low-level Laser Therapy in Extensor Tendon Injuries Between Zones 5-8
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Low-level Laser Therapy in Extensor Tendon Injuries Between Zones 5-8: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study examines the rehabilitation results when low-level laser therapy is applied in zone 5-8 extensor tendon injuries. Rehabilitation results will be evaluated with both objective measurements and patient reported outcome measures. The study was planned as a double-blind, placebo-controlled, randomized, two-arm study. Participants in both treatment groups will be given exercise therapy in accordance with the early active mobilization protocol and appropriate splint will be given to be used while exercising.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in total active motion degrees
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, immediately after the intervention, eighth week
primary_outcome.description: The difference of active range of motion (ROM) measurements between injured and non-injured digit(s). ROM measurement will be made with the help of a standard hand goniometer and the measured degree will be recorded.
Grip strength measurement will be made with the Jamar dynamometer. The measured value will be recorded in kilograms.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in visual analog scale (VAS) score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, immediately after the intervention, eighth week
primary_outcome.description: VAS is a scale used to assess pain. Minimum value of the scale is 0 and maximum is 10. Higher scores mean a worse outcome.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, immediately after the intervention, eighth week
primary_outcome.description: It will be used to evaluate edema in the dorsum of the hand. Measurement will be made with the help of a tape measure. The measured value will be recorded in milimeters.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quick disabilities of arm, shoulder and hand (QuickDASH) score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, immediately after the intervention, eighth week
secondary_outcome.description: A scale used for measuring physical function and symptoms of upper extremities. Minimum value of the scale is 0 and maximum is 100. Higher scores mean a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-intervention, immediately after the intervention, eighth week
secondary_outcome.description: A scale used for determining quality of life. This form evaluates the quality of life under 9 different headings. Minimum value of all headings is %0 and maximum is %100. Higher scores mean a better outcome.
The rehabilitation period required for patients to return to work

arm_group.arm_group_label: Treatment group of low level laser therapy
Sham group of low level laser therapy

intervention.description: We will use laser light that has continuous wave mode, power of 100 mW, energy density of 7,5 joule/cm2, treatment time as 300 seconds.
intervention.arm_group_label: Sham group of low level laser therapy
Treatment group of low level laser therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Being between the ages of 18-65
- Primary repair due to extensor tendon injury between Zones V-VIII
- Applying to the Hand Rehabilitation Policlinic at the end of the postoperative 1st week
Exclusion Criteria:
- Accompanying flexor tendon injury, fracture, vascular and / or nerve injury
- Active using of steroids or non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs
- Systemic infection or malignancy
- Pregnant or breastfeeding women
- Active wound infection
- Having a cognitive dysfunction

reference.citation: Collocott SJF, Kelly E, Foster M, Myhr H, Wang A, Ellis RF. A randomized clinical trial comparing early active motion programs: Earlier hand function, TAM, and orthotic satisfaction with a relative motion extension program for zones V and VI extensor tendon repairs. J Hand Ther. 2020 Jan - Mar;33(1):13-24. doi: 10.1016/j.jht.2018.10.003. Epub 2019 Mar 21.

Poorpezeshk N, Ghoreishi SK, Bayat M, Pouriran R, Yavari M. Early Low-Level Laser Therapy Improves the Passive Range of Motion and Decreases Pain in Patients with Flexor Tendon Injury. Photomed Laser Surg. 2018 Oct;36(10):530-535. doi: 10.1089/pho.2018.4458.
